intro: Croton barotsensis, commonly known as the Barotseland croton, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful foliage. The plant typically has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its unique appearance.
